prompt: <description>**Part 1: Creating a Rectangular Prism with a Cylindrical Hole** **Step 1: Coordinate System** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) degrees and the translation vector to (0.0, 0.0296, 0.0). This will position and orient the prism on the canvas. **Step 2: Sketching the Prism Face** Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw the first line segment with start point at (0.0, 0.0) and end point at (0.0, 0.0691). This will define the left side of the prism. Draw the second line segment with start point at (0.0, 0.0691) and end point at (0.0, 0.1382). This will define the front side of the prism. Draw the third arc segment with start point at (0.0, 0.1382), mid point at (0.0289, 0.2079), and end point at (0.0987, 0.2368). This will define the curved side of the prism. Draw the fourth line segment with start point at (0.0987, 0.2368) and end point at (0.75, 0.2368). This will define the right side of the prism. Draw the fifth line segment with start point at (0.75, 0.2368) and end point at (0.75, 0.1579). This will define the back side of the prism. Draw the sixth line segment with start point at (0.75, 0.1579) and end point at (0.2169, 0.118). This will define the top side of the prism, excluding the curved portion. Draw the seventh arc segment with start point at (0.2169, 0.118), mid point at (0.1473, 0.0891), and end point at (0.1184, 0.0195). This will define the curved portion of the top side of the prism. Draw the eighth line segment with start point at (0.1184, 0.0195) and end point at (0.1184, 0.0). This will complete the top side of the prism. Draw a circle on the same plane with center at (0.0987, 0.1382) and a radius of 0.0493. This will define the cylindrical hole going through the prism. Close the loop to complete the sketch. **Step 3: Extruding the Sketch** Extrude the sketch along its normal vector with a depth of 0.0296 units, creating a solid prism. Use a sketch scale of 0.75 for any scaling operations. The resulting prism should be 0.75 units in length, with a width of 0.0296 units, and a height of 0.75 units. **Step 4: Completing the Body Operation** Join the newly created prism with the existing body to combine the shapes and create the final shape. **Final shape:** The final shape consists of a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole through its center and a flat top and bottom. The prism is positioned at an angle and is slightly tilted to the right. The top edge is slightly angled. The prism has a curved side and a flat top and bottom. The prism is centered on the white background. The prism has a curved top edge and a flat bottom edge. The top edge is slightly angled. The prism is 0.75 units in length, 0.0296 units in width, and 0.75 units in height.</description>

Line (line_2) has a start point of [0.0081, 0.0] and an end point of [0.0, 0.0]. c. The loop, as well as all curves, should be closed. 3. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.5897 (sketch_scale). 4. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector with a distance of 0.75 units, resulting in the final CAD part. Use the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" for the boolean operation of the current body with the preceding body. Remember to create accurate and well-defined curves, loops, and faces in order to generate a precise 3D model. Refer to the sketch JSON and dimensional information provided to ensure the best results.</description>

Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.125, 0.0, 0.125]. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.1162, 0.5, 0.5085]. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.5, 0.1158, 0.137]. Create the first face: - Loop 1 contains 1 circle: - Circle 1: Center [0.125, 0.125], Radius 0.125 Extrude the face upwards by `0.25` units in the positive Z direction. Once all parts are created, the final shape will be a 3D model of a cylindrical object with a rectangular opening on one side, connected to a cylindrical tube. The opening has dimensions approximately `0.5 x 0.25` units, and the cylindrical tube has a diameter that is approximately `0.25` units and a height of `0.25` units. The overall height of the final shape is approximately `1.25` units.</description>
